page.title: 10Transport
page.content: Northwest corner of St Leonards Forest is crossed by two main roads. The most important being the A264 from Horsham to Crawley and beyond, via Faygate, Till last autumn it was a winding road though fields past a few houses and farms a public house, The Cherry Tree, and only branching out into a dual carriage way at Crawley end. A new northern bypass is under construction for Horsham and the upgrading an improving ofCrawley road is part of scheme. To accommodate the traffic in crease a dual carriage way is being carved through the countryside along the existing road. Great chunks of countryside have been dug up and out. A lot of natural woodland uprooted. Traffic holdups due to construction work are a daily concern, and many drivers use the other road via Colgate thus making it
